unit_learning_outcomes.description: Assess challenges facing multinational corporations when implementing internationalisation from a firm's perspective.
Successfully work in teams and reflect on teamwork strategies in achieving group objectives.
Evaluate the impact of contextual factors on the management of a firm's internationalisation.
Develop and justify management solutions for implementing internationalisation strategies.
Research and analyse key internationalisation functional units and practices for an existing firm.

enrolment_rules.description: 70cp at 1000 level or above including BUS201 or MGMT1005

assessments.description: This assessments consists of two components worth 45% total. The first component is a group report of up to 3,000 words worth 25%. The second component is an individual reflection report of up to 1,500 words worth 20%.
A case study analysis report of up to 2,000 words worth 25%.
A two-hour closed-book examination worth 30% will be held during the University Examination Period.
A two-hour online examination, administered via iLearn and worth 30% will be held during the University Examination Period.

Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 2, Special circumstances
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit introduces students to the key concepts of business operations from a firm perspective while internationalising. Major issues considered include modes of international expansion; the management of international strategic cooperation; an emphasis on small to medium size businesses and how they compete on a global level; and the development of new international organisation forms and their implications for management in various functional and operational areas. Structure and strategy are explored from the perspective of their roles as foundations of the organisation, with an emphasis on how all types of businesses have grappled with the operational and organisational challenges of International Business. Skills in problem solving and teamwork are developed.
data.title: International Business Operations
